page.title: 10Transport in the Barham area
page.content: Black Robin was a local highwayman, who was eventually caught and hanged at the site of the present crossroads on the A2.This road is one of the oldest in England(Roman). Henry 8th camped beside it en-route to France to meet Catherine of Aragon.During the short life of the Elham Valley Railway,the B2065 was less important.Now it is the only link between villages in the valley.The bus service(617)began in 1921,running twice a day both ways.Now on week days 7 buses travel each way. The A2 is well serviced with buses going from Canterbury to Dover and Folkestone(via Denton).There is no bus service for Womenswold and Woolage Green.The car is the most popular method of transport and the majority of people work outside the area.Being a main route from Dover to London,the A2 is busiest in holiday periods.
